DataElement.preferredName: Autoimmune Or Immunodeficiency Disease or Disorder Personal Medical History Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Yes/no indicator to signify a diagnosis or history of condition(s) in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them or a disorder in which the immune system is unable to mount an adequate immune response.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Autoimmune Or Immunodeficiency Disease or Disorder Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to a history of condition(s) in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them or a disorder in which the immune system is unable to mount an adequate immune response.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Autoimmune Disease Or Immunodeficiency Disease or Disorder
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A condition in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A disorder in which the immune system is unable to mount an adequate immune response.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: A disorder resulting from loss of function or tissue destruction of an organ or multiple organs, arising from humoral or cellular immune responses of the individual to his own tissue constituents. It may be systemic (e.g., systemic lupus erythematosus), or organ specific, (e.g., thyroiditis).

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A disorder in which the immune system is unable to mount an adequate immune response.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Existing diagnosis or history
ReferenceDocuments.description: Existing diagnosis or history of autoimmune disorders or conditions of immunsuppression

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of an autoimmune disorder, including type 1 diabetes mellitus, pemphigus vulgaris, systemic mastocytosis, systemic lupus erythromatosis, dermatomyositis/polymyositis, rheumatoid arthritis, systemic sclerosis, Sjörgen's syndrome, vasculitis/arteritis, Behcet's syndrome, autoimmune thyroiditis, multiple sclerosis, or uveitis

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC Question
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of or currently have evidence of autoimmune disease including: myasthenia gravis, Guillain Barre syndrome, systemic lupus erythematosus, multiple sclerosis, scleroderma, ulcerative colitis, Crohn's disease, autoimmune hepatitis, Wegener's, etc?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG CRF
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of or ongoing autoimmune disease?

DataElement.changeDescription: removed upside down question marks in CITN alt question text. 2/25/16 jk  created for UAMS 1/15/15 cmr
